translation.text: Dhanaasaree, First Mehl, Second House:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: How can I remember the Lord in meditation? I cannot meditate on Him in remembrance.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: My heart is burning, and my soul is crying out in pain.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

translation.text: The True Lord creates and adorns.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

translation.text: Forgetting Him, how can one be good? ||1||

translation.text: By clever tricks and commands, He cannot be found.

text: ਕਿਉ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਚਿ ਮਿਲਉ ਮੇਰੀ ਮਾਇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: How am I to meet my True Lord, O my mother? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: kiu kar sāch milau mērī māi .1. rahāu .

translation.text: How rare is the one who goes out, and searches for the merchandise of the Naam.

text: ਨਾ ਕੋ ਚਾਖੈ ਨਾ ਕੋ ਖਾਇ ॥

translation.text: No one tastes it, and no one eats it.

transliteration.text: nā kō chākhai nā kō khāi .

text: ਤਾ ਪਤਿ ਰਹੈ ਰਾਖੈ ਜਾ ਸੋਇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: One's honor is preserved, only if the Lord preserves it. ||2||

transliteration.text: tā pat rahai rākhai jā sōi .2.

translation.text: Wherever I look, there I see Him, pervading and permeating.

translation.text: Without You, I have no other place of rest.

text: ਜੇ ਕੋ ਕਰੇ ਕੀਤੈ ਕਿਆ ਹੋਇ ॥

translation.text: He may try, but what can anyone do by his own doing?

transliteration.text: jē kō karē kītai kiā hōi .

translation.text: He alone is blessed, whom the True Lord forgives. ||3||

text: ਹੁਣਿ ਉਠਿ ਚਲਣਾ ਮੁਹਤਿ ਕਿ ਤਾਲਿ ॥

translation.text: Now, I shall have to get up and depart, in an instant, in the clapping of hands.

transliteration.text: hun uth chalanā muhat k tāl .

text: ਕਿਆ ਮੁਹੁ ਦੇਸਾ ਗੁਣ ਨਹੀ ਨਾਲਿ ॥

translation.text: What face will I show the Lord? I have no virtue at all.

transliteration.text: kiā muh dēsā gun nahī nāl .

translation.text: As is the Lord's Glance of Grace, so it is.
